pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.11_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.14_0: The first rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood contemptuously, as if not wanting to eat it. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.3.1_0: “‘I will eat almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.4_0: Almsfood is to be eaten respectfully.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood contemptuously, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
